intro: Sinosenecio subcoriaceus, commonly known as the rough leaf sinosenecio, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, rough-textured leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. It produces small, yellow flowers arranged in clusters, typical of the daisy family. Sinosenecio subcoriaceus is often found in rocky or mountainous habitats, thriving in well-drained soils.
